articles.headline: After a Rocky Year, Zuckerberg Lays Out Meta’s Road Map to Employees
articles.snippet: In an internal all-hands meeting, the chief executive explained his plans for artificial intelligence, the metaverse and rebooting Meta’s culture.
articles.abstract: In an internal all-hands meeting, the chief executive explained his plans for artificial intelligence, the metaverse and rebooting Meta’s culture.
articles.lead_paragraph: Mark Zuckerberg has spent the last nine months against the ropes as his company has made big cuts to its work force and struggled to gain mainstream traction with its ambitious plans for virtual reality.

articles.headline: Ukraine Mounts Multiple Attacks on Russian Occupiers
articles.snippet: The assaults, with Western tanks and armored vehicles, appear to mark a long-awaited counteroffensive that Ukraine hopes will retake territory and shore up allies’ resolve to keep supplying weapons.
articles.abstract: The assaults, with Western tanks and armored vehicles, appear to mark a long-awaited counteroffensive that Ukraine hopes will retake territory and shore up allies’ resolve to keep supplying weapons.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ukrainian forces mounted a major attack in the southern region of Zaporizhzhia on Thursday, taking the offensive against the invading Russians in multiple places in the east and south, but there was no indication of a breakthrough in an operation that carries high stakes for Kyiv and its Western allies.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Andrew E. Kramer

articles.headline: Indictment Brings Trump Story Full Circle
articles.snippet: The former president assailed Hillary Clinton for her handling of sensitive information. Now, the same issue threatens his chances of reclaiming the presidency.
articles.abstract: The former president assailed Hillary Clinton for her handling of sensitive information. Now, the same issue threatens his chances of reclaiming the presidency.

articles.headline: Justice Department Charges Trump in Documents Case
articles.snippet: The indictment, handed up by a grand jury in Miami, is the first time a former U.S. president has faced federal charges.
articles.abstract: The indictment, handed up by a grand jury in Miami, is the first time a former U.S. president has faced federal charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department on Thursday took the legally and politically momentous step of lodging federal criminal charges against former President Donald J. Trump, accusing him of mishandling classified documents he kept upon leaving office and then obstructing the government’s efforts to reclaim them.
articles.byline: By Alan Feuer, Maggie Haberman, William K. Rashbaum and Ben Protess

articles.headline: Energy Drinks Are Surging. So Are Their Caffeine Levels.
articles.snippet: More companies are pushing low-calorie, sugar-free beverages they say are healthy. Some servings have nearly the same level of caffeine as a six-pack of Coca-Cola.
articles.abstract: More companies are pushing low-calorie, sugar-free beverages they say are healthy. Some servings have nearly the same level of caffeine as a six-pack of Coca-Cola.
articles.lead_paragraph: It has been more than 25 years since Red Bull hit the market and introduced caffeinated energy drinks to the United States. While the company claimed its beverage would “give you wings,” it never said it was actually good for people.

articles.headline: What All the Single Ladies (and Men) Say About the Economy
articles.snippet: A major jeweler claims the pandemic may have prevented people from meeting their future fiancés, cutting demand for engagement rings. Inflation and anxiety among shoppers haven’t helped.
articles.abstract: A major jeweler claims the pandemic may have prevented people from meeting their future fiancés, cutting demand for engagement rings. Inflation and anxiety among shoppers haven’t helped.
articles.lead_paragraph: Aftershocks from the coronavirus pandemic continue to rumble across the U.S. economy, and Signet Jewelers shared a surprising one this week: The company is selling fewer engagement rings this year because, it says, singles who were stuck at home during lockdowns failed to meet their would-be fiancés in 2020.
articles.byline: By Jeanna Smialek and Jason Karaian

articles.headline: Energy Tax Credits, Meant to Help U.S. Suppliers, May Be Hard to Get
articles.snippet: The Inflation Reduction Act contains tax breaks for solar and wind companies to buy American equipment. Qualifying won’t be easy.
articles.abstract: The Inflation Reduction Act contains tax breaks for solar and wind companies to buy American equipment. Qualifying won’t be easy.
articles.lead_paragraph: In April, Vice President Kamala Harris visited Qcells, a solar panel manufacturing facility in Dalton, Ga., to announce an early triumph of the Inflation Reduction Act: Summit Ridge Energy, one of the nation’s largest developers of community solar projects, would purchase 2.5 million U.S.-made solar panels.
